Key Arguments: The proposed legislation violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill raises unanswered questions about who determines truth, harm, misinformation, and disinformation.
The legislation does not apply to the government or mainstream media, which is seen as a double standard.
Censorship by the government leads to dystopia and totalitarianism.
Freedom of speech is fundamental to democracy and all other freedoms depend on it.
Notable Quotes: This proposed amendment of the Communications Legislation is an abomination to Our Human Rights.
Once a Government starts Censoring the People, then the People and the Country are well and truly on the Road to Dystopia and Totalitarianism.
If we lose that, we lose our democracy in this country.
